did.unittitle: Frederic V. Malek papers
did.abstract: Speeches and writings, correspondence, memoranda, reports, and notes relating to domestic politics and administration of the federal government during the presidencies of Richard M. Nixon and Gerald R. Ford. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Frederic V. Malek papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1984.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Chairman, Triangle Corporation, Columbia, South Carolina
Deputy Under Secretary, Department of Health, Education and Welfare
Special Assistant to President Richard M. Nixon
Deputy Director, Committee for the Re-election of the President
Deputy Director, Office of Management and Budget
Author, Washington's Hidden Tragedy: The Failure to Make Government Work

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms Available
altformavail.p: Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

controlaccess.corpname: United States. Office of Management and Budget.

did.unittitle: BIOGRAPHICAL FILE,
Clippings,
SPEECHES AND WRITINGS,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts and printed copies of speeches and writings with related correspondence. Arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: General
General. Memoranda, letters, and schedules,
Background material. Notes, letters, clippings and speeches by William Simon, Arthur Burns and others, primarily relating to banking and economic policy,
"Assessment of Management Quality," Business Horizons, Reprint
"Analysis and Recommendations--The Food and Drug Administration Organizational Review," Food and Drug Cosmetic Law Journal, Printed article
"Master Plan for Merger Negotiations," Harvard Business Review, Reprint
"Management Improvement in the Federal Government: An Inside View," Business Horizons, Reprint
"Management Improvement in HEW: An Inside View," Management Review, Printed article
Interview, Clipping
Speech, Typescript
Speech, Typescript
Speech, Typescript
Speech, Typescript and a letter
"One That Got Away," New York Times, Clipping and a letter
Speech, Typescript
Testimony, U.S. Senate, Committee on Government Operations, Budgeting, Management and Expenditures Subcommittee, Typescript
"Real Nixon Accomplishments Go Unheralded," Los Angeles Times, Typescript, letters and a clipping
Speech, Typescript and a letter
Speech, Typescript and a letter
"Managing for Results in the Federal Government," Business Horizons, Reprint
"The New Federalism--Making it Work," Typescript
Speech, Typescript
Speeches, Notes, typescripts, letter, and clippings
"The New Federalism: The Kind of Change We Need," Chicago Tribune, Typescript and clipping
"New Federalism: Giving Government Back to the People," Typescript, letters, and clippings
Speech, Typescript and letters
Speech, Typescript and memorandum
"The Federal Dollars in New Federalism," Typescript, letters and a flyer
"The Development of Public Executives--Neglect and Reform," Public Administration Review, Reprint
Letter to the Editor, Wall Street Journal, Typescript and clipping
Speech, Typescript
Interview, Notes and a draft statement
"Reflections on Five and One Half Years with President Nixon," Typescript and a letter
"The New Federalism," Typescript and a letter
"The Art and Politics of Public Management," Notes, a letter and other miscellaneous materials relating to a Harvard University study group
Washington's Hidden Tragedy: The Failure to Make Government Work,
General
Background material
Correspondence and comments. NOTE: Specific chapter comments are with those chapters
Outlines and notes
Chapters. Typescripts, notes, letters and comments, clippings, printed articles and other background materials
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH, EDUCATION AND WELFARE FILE,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Speech transcript, letters, reports, appointment book, clippings, printed articles, procedural manual, charts, memoranda, and agenda. Primarily relates to management planning within the agency. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: General
General. Speech transcript, a photocopy of a letter from Elliot Richardson to Barry Goldwater, and a brief summary of authorizing legislation,
Appointment book,
Clippings and printed articles,
Management planning
General. Charts, reports, agenda and memoranda,
Reports and procedural manuals. Includes cover memoranda and reports written by Frederic Malek for H.R. Haldeman and others,
WHITE HOUSE FILE,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet, press releases, charts, letters, appointment books, clippings, minutes, reports, memoranda, printed articles, notes, and lists. Relates to the organization of the Executive Branch, personnel, and high-level appointments in the Nixon Administration. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: General
General. Pamphlet of statements by Richard Nixon, charts entitled "Legislative Infringements or Limitations on the Executive," press releases, and a letter of reply to Lyndon B. Johnson,
Appointment books,
Clippings,
Cabinet meetings. Minutes,
Information leaks. Primarily monthly progress reports relating to an improper disclosure directive,
Magruder, Jeb S. Memoranda relating to job placement,
Organization and reorganization of the Executive branch. SEE ALSO: OFFICE OF MANAGEMENT AND BUDGET FILE/Reorganization
General. Press releases, clippings, reports, memoranda, letter, and printed articles,
Transition (post-1972 election). Memoranda and reports relating to transition plans; includes a memorandum from Richard Nixon to H.R. Haldeman relating to the CIA,
White House staff. Reports, notes, charts, printed article, and memoranda relating primarily to White House personnel, legal services, and public relations functions,
Recruiting and placement
General
General. Relates to vacancies and personnel searches
Memoranda,
Notes. Primarily meetings with other White House staff members and advisors,
Consultants. Proposals and notes,
Sources. Memorandum from H.R. Haldeman to Richard Nixon,
White House Task Force on Executive Manpower. List and handbook,
Ambassadors. Lists, memoranda, letters, and a press release,
Departments
General. Memoranda and notes primarily relating to Cabinet-level appointments,
Agriculture Department. Memoranda,
Commerce Department. Memoranda and a schedule,
Defense Department. Memoranda,
Health, Education and Welfare Department. Memoranda,
Housing and Urban Development Department. Memoranda,
Interior Department. List and memoranda,
Justice Department. Memoranda,
Labor Department. Memoranda,
State Department. Memoranda,
Transportation Department. Memoranda,
Treasury Department. Memoranda, clipping and a letter,

Independent agencies and regulatory commissions. Memoranda, letter, notes, a clipping, and biographies. Includes material relating to the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, the Securities and Exchange Commission, ACTION, the Atomic Energy Commission, the Federal Reserve Board, and others; also includes material relating to a U.S. Senate symposium on regulatory agency appointments,
Schorr, Daniel. Clippings, press release, memoranda, notes and letters from Sen. Sam Ervin, Jr.,
COMMITTEE FOR THE RE-ELECTION OF THE PRESIDENT FILE,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, radio transcript, correspondence, memoranda, reports, pamphlets, a deposition and other legal materials. Primarily relates to informal recommendations on whether or not various organizations should receive grant funding. Arranged alphabetically by form.

did.unittitle: Clippings. Includes a transcript of a new report by Walter Cronkite for CBS radio,
Correspondence. Notes and correspondence with Senators Sam Ervin, Jr., Robert Byrd, Herman Talmadge, Mike Mansfield and Howard Baker, Jr., relating to specific projects,
Memoranda
General. Collected memoranda and a short report entitled "Administration Efforts in Support of the Re-election."

Memoranda from Frederic Malek to H.R. Haldeman and others, relating primarily to convention planning, press and public relations, and the re-direction of the White House staff to support the re-election of Richard Nixon
Publications. Republican National Committee,
Report. "Use of the Incumbency-Reponsiveness Program", with memoranda analyzing the report,
Testimony. Deposition by Frederic Malek, letters and miscellaneous legal material,
OFFICE OF MANAGEMENT AND BUDGET FILE,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, correspondence, appointment book, reports, speeches, memoranda, printed articles, press releases, notes, budgets, agenda, and a pamphlet. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: General. Clippings, letter, interview outline, appointment book, and reports,
Budgets
General. Clippings, primarily relating to the Carter Administration,
Economic analyses. Speech, proposals, and memoranda relating to wage-price controls and general economic policy,
FY 1974. Fact sheet, report, and memoranda,
FY
Memoranda,
Public relations material. Press releases, statements by Richard Nixon and Frederic Malek, charts, and notes for presentations, primarily to various Congressional committees,
Reviews. Director's review of HEW budget and materials for a presidential review of energy, science and natural resources agencies,
FY Statement, report, press release and charts, 1975
Domestic policy
General. Memoranda and proposals,
White House Domestic Council. Memoranda,
Management
General. Memoranda, agenda, report, and correspondence with Sen. Harry F. Byrd, Jr.,
Management by Objectives program. Reports, memoranda, letters, agency proposals, presidential objectives, agenda, and printed articles,
Personnel
General. Memoranda, pamphlet, and notes,
Federal Executive Development Program. Memoranda and reports,
President's Commission on Personnel Interchange. Letter, agenda and background materials for meetings, memoranda, and a pamphlet,
Reorganization
General. Memoranda, proposals, press releases and notes, SEE ALSO: WHITE HOUSE FILE/Reorganization
Office of Management and Budget. Proposals, letter, printed articles, meeting notes, charts, and memoranda,
Undersecretaries group. Memoranda, meeting reports and notes; includes material relating to conferences at Camp David,
SUBJECT FILE,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, letters, charts, reports, notes, printed articles, and clippings relating to other government departments. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: Commerce Department. Pamphlets relating to department objectives and management conferences,
Drug Enforcement Administration. Notes, printed article, clipping, statement, a letter and a report,
Housing and Urban Development Department. Reports, charts and letters, including a photocopy of a letter from Gerald Ford,
AUDIO-VISUAL FILE,
Photographs,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 3 prints and one proof sheet of a swearing-in ceremony, with Frank Zarb, Frederic Malek, and others; one print and one proof sheet of Frederick Malek.

did.unittitle: DECLASSIFIED U.S. GOVERNMENT RECORDS,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government, released in full or in part. Available as PDF files. The PDF files are page images, so full-text search is not possible. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover, thereunder by date of creation.

did.unittitle: Record released in 2010,
